Html:
I am trying to use the GMap.Net for WPF component in an MFC-based application.  The application has the code to draw objects (e.g., points, lines that link the points on a map). I want to leverage the existing unmanaged drawing code for now.  My question is if it is possible to draw a native layer on top of the WPF map control and what will be the best approach to do so.  It would be ideal if I could display the native layer and synch operations like zoom, dezoom, and scale, etc.

So far, I am able to embed the WPF map control in the CView derived class and display the map as the SDI view via the HwndSource.

Any suggestins will be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,

jwang
